intro: Sagittipetalum palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking inflorescences with a spathe and spadix, typical of the arum family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
